alert.note: Alert for Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued March 09 at 3:26AM HST until March 10 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI THROUGH TONIGHT... ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND THROUGH TONIGHT... .A large long period northwest swell will peak early this morning, bringing extra large to giant surf to north and west facing shores and large surf for Leeward Big Island. The combination of large wind waves due to strong westerly winds and long-period swell energy will result in very rough and hazardous conditions through tonight. The swell will decline and become north northwesterly Friday through the weekend. ...HIGH SURF WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of 12 to 16 ft. * WHERE...West facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Friday. * IMPACTS...High. Expect very strong breaking waves and powerful currents. Waves breaking in channel entrances may make navigating the channels dangerous.
info.instruction: Stay away from the shoreline along the affected coasts. Be prepared for road closures. Postpone entering or leaving channels affected by the high surf until the surf subsides.
